a "greater stench" to the scandal that was only just starting to unravel. " Andy Coulson is no longer the issue and to some extent he never was," he said. First there's the issue of David Cameron and George Osborne 's judgement, then there's the News of the World and what appears to be industrial phone hacking going on systematically. "There's also the issue of the News Corp takeover of BSkyB and the apparent attempts by Jeremy Hunt, the Culture Secretary, to let that go through without proper scrutiny, and finally there's the extraordinary conduct of the police. Mr Andy Coulson resigned as editor of the News of the World in 2007 after the paper's former royal editor, Clive Goodman , and private investigator Glenn Mulcaire were jailed for phone hacking.
